awd_titl_txt: Collaborative Research: Building Cybersecurity Capacity in Pervasive Computing
awd_abstract_narration:
This project aims to build cybersecurity capacity of the United States in pervasive computing. Although significant efforts have been made in addressing the security and privacy issues of pervasive computing in research community, a strategic implementation that promotes workforce development from both academic and experiential learning in cybersecurity education is still lacking in pervasive computing. It is imperative to bring cybersecurity research results into education, cultivate the well prepared cybersecurity workforce, and strengthen the long-term collaboration among academic institutions, industry, and government. 

The project identifies five major objectives in security and privacy issues of pervasive computing: 1) developing new courses and course modules; 2) constructing hands-on virtual labs; 3) engaging students in research with timely research topics; 4) establishing and strengthening relationships with partners; and 5) developing career interest and professional capabilities in cybersecurity with a focus on women and underrepresented students. Unified under the central theme of security and privacy, the wide coverage of cyberspace facets in pervasive computing will allow students to learn the state-of-the-art research findings, gain hands-on experiences from the most up-to-date software, platforms, and infrastructures, engage in scientific research in their best interests, and obtain a comprehensive in-breadth appreciation of the overall cybersecurity state-of-the-art through the new courses and labs, industry-sponsored capstones, cooperative research projects, cybersecurity student organizations, invited talks, and webinars held by the proposed project.

por.por_cntn:
The major goals of this project are to provide a comprehensive coverage of cybersecurity education, create a well prepared cybersecurity workforce, and strengthen the long-term collaboration with industry, government, and other academic institutions in cybersecurity with pervasive computing in general, and cloud computing, software-defined networking, mobile computing, vehicular ad-hoc networks, cyber-physical system, and digital forensics in particular.

Intellectual Merit:

  1. We have designed, implemented and evaluated the ReScuE (Range for Security Education), a cloud-based virtual platform for cybersecurity education and workforce development.
  2. Several new courses have been developed, including Non-cryptographic Methods for Network Security and Privacy, Vehicular Ad-hoc Networking (VANET) Security and Privacy
  3. One (1) Book Chapter, five (5) journal papers, sixteen (16) conference papers, and two (2) posters have been published. 
  4. Six (6) dissertations and several software packages have been produced.

Broader Impacts:

  1. Dr. Fu was interviewed by the TV7 (WXYZ-DET (ABC) - Detroit, MI) to comment on the cybersecurity concerns of FaceApp.
  2. Dr. Fu was interviewed to comment on the “Facebook data selling story.” The interview ran in Detroit, Miami, Houston, Jacksonville, Orlando, San Antonio and Roanoke.
  3. Our students won 1st Place three (3) times in a roll at the Detroit Chapter ISACA (Information Systems Audit and Control Association, https://www.isaca.org/) Scholarship Competition.
  4. Our students won the award for the Best Poster Award at the 2018 IEEE International Conference in Consumer Electronics (ICCE).
  5. Our students won the award for Best Full Paper Award at the 12th annual Cyber and Information Security Research Conference (CISRC2017) held at the Oak Ridge National Laboratory in Tennessee.
  6. The National Security Agency (NSA) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) designated Oakland University as the National Center of Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense Education (NCAE-C) in May 2018.
  7. OU has been fostering continued cybersecurity awareness in Michigan via
  • Girl Scouts Hackathon Volunteers
  • GrizzHacks Hackathon
  • Michigan Office of Attorney General
  • Press Release
  • Public Media Interviews
  • Invited Talks
